JobFullDesc: Cloud Ops Engineer  Deloitte Consulting's Products & Solutions (P&S) practice develops products that augment our leading services practice and strike at the heart of our clients' business needs. Deloitte's commitment to innovation is inspiring our clients to new possibilities; our asset-based consulting agenda is designed to deliver tangible results in the near-term and sustainable competitive advantage for years to come.  Are you looking for an organization with startup spirit or enterprise strength? Now you can have both! We are looking for talented individuals with an innovative mindset and technical skillset to join our growing team. Work you'll do  The Cloud Ops Engineer will be responsible for design and deployment of scalable, reliable and secure cloud infrastructure in FedRamp accredited environments. This individual must have a thorough understanding and experience with AWS GovCloud. Other cloud service offerings like GCP and Azure are a plus. Must be an innovative problem solver, and visionary. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge in FedRAMP accredited cloud architectures and operations procedures. Knowledgeable in the Authorization to Operate (ATO) processes. The Cloud OPS Engineer will be focused on the following activities:  Implementation of AWS GovCloud hosting environments, focus on client facing workloads  Coordinating deployments with project teams and collogues  Support of multiple cloud environments, Primarily AWS GovCloud. This includes developing design Principles and for scalable, secure infrastructure  Researching and evaluating the FedRAMP accredited cloud technologies, tools, and capabilities to improve operational efficiencies and provide new services  Contribute to the development and implement the strategy to automate deployments wherever possible  Work with architects and operations staff  Work with operations teams to onboard cloud solutions  Provide guidance, and work with application owners, and solution groups to ensure proper architecture, function, and security standards are being followed for client projects and solutions in Deloitte's hosting ecosystem  Provide cloud costing, cloud resource pricing and RFP response for client projects and solutions in Deloitte's hosting ecosystems The team  Deloitte Innovation & Platforms is an organization within Deloitte Consulting with the goal of building a culture of continuous innovation to drive profitable revenue through the identification, incubation, and actualization of breakthrough ideas in assets-based client offerings. The Cloud Hosting Infrastructure Team architects, deploys, and supports the cloud environments through the entire project lifecycle. Qualifications  Required:  US citizenship required for public sector clients. Ability to attain secret clearance.  3+ years of relevant professional experience working in a FedRAMP accredited GovCloud environment  Bachelor-level degree in engineering, information technology, data communications, telecommunications, computer science, or equivalent educational or professional experience and/or qualifications.  Demonstrate expert experience with architecting, implementing, administering, and securing FedRAMP accredited GovCloud environments  Knowledgeable in Authorization to Operate (ATO) processes  Experienced in IaaS technologies such as EC2, EBS, S3, RDS, Elastic Load Balancing, beanstalk  Experienced in management tools such as IAM, KMS, CloudWatch, CloudFormation, Quickstart, CloudTrail, Config, and Service Catalog  Experience with networking and security in an AWS GovCloud environment including NACLs, security groups, connecting VPCs and DNS  Experience with virtual devices such as firewalls, ELB, VPG, & internet gateways.  Design, Deployment, and STIG experience in Red Hat and Windows.  Expert in AWS GovCloud computing technologies.  Knowledge of full lifecycle management of environments from deployment, through maintenance, to decommission  Ability to work with service providers to enable managed services. Strong troubleshooting, problem solving, and issue management skills  Knowledge of emerging cloud technology solutions, industry trends, and progressive operations methodology.  Excellent oral and written communications ability. Must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization  Preferred:  Certifications in cloud technologies preferred  Other operating systems on top of RedHat and Windows are a plus  Knowledge in other cloud technologies such as Azure, and Google is a plus.  #NBI22
